titleStmt.title: Phinehas, or, The common duty of all men, and the special duty of magistrates, to be zealous and active in the execution of laws against scandalous sins and debauchery and of that in particular, against prophane cursing and swearing.
titleStmt.author: Stephens, Edward, d. 1706.

titleStmt.title: Phinehas, or, The common duty of all men, and the special duty of magistrates, to be zealous and active in the execution of laws against scandalous sins and debauchery and of that in particular, against prophane cursing and swearing.
titleStmt.author: Stephens, Edward, d. 1706.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Richard Smith, at the Angel near Lincolns-Inn Back-gate. And are to be sold by Richard Baldwin, at the Oxford-Armes in Warwick-Lane,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: William Andrews Clark Memorial Library, University of California, Los Angeles, California.
